comments.body: Thus if it is not Python 2.7 or Python 3.x, this section doesn't appear. In those cases, this section is empty anyways. This will workaround the `conda-build` issue.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +5,9 @@  version: {{ version }}

source:  # [py27 or py3k]
  # Avro exist as two versions in apache avro for py2 and py3.
  fn: avro-{{ version }}.tar.gz  # [py27]

comments.body: I know I asked this, but I think the reply got buried. Why do what Python 3 and Python 2 sources that are different?
Mostly since that is how apache avro structured their code.  They have both a py and a py3 tree in their source repository.  They've supported python 3 since the very scary days of 3.0 i believe.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@  fn: avro-python3-{{ version }}.tar.gz  # [py3k]
  url: https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/a/avro-python3/avro-python3-{{ version }}.tar.gz  # [py3k]
  md5: bd36c1e6fbb77ccff58c60bed48b982e  # [py3k]

build:
